captain melt had just brought the

so that everyone could gain some infield
experience within the great orcas
labyrinth though the deepest floor that
they could confidently go was to xx it
was known as the floor that separated
the skilled adventurers from the
amateurs the deepest anyone had ever
gone was to floor 65 however no one had
been able to reach those depths in a
while even getting to floor 40 was
considered to be a superhuman feat so
the 20th floor became known as the
standard level to indicate one skill
for the time that this labyrinth has
existed every floor down until the 47th
was completely mapped out but because
each floor spanned a few kilometers in
every direction it took at least a month
or two to completely map a new one
though
just having the first 20 floors mapped
out significantly reduces the amount of
danger that any of them would face while
traversing the dungeon now this
expedition wasn't scheduled for toll the
day after so Hodgman was just spending
his time laying in this small bedroom at
the end pondering all that could happen
while in the dungeon it was around 1 or
2 a.m. when he finally decided to go to
bed but that's when he heard a knock on
the door it was a bit strange because
although this time at night wouldn't be
considered late for him to the average
person this wasn't a standard time to be
awake and so he was suspicious that who
it could be
and even more so when he opened the door
to see that it was coyote standing there
she wanted to come in and talk and as
much as Hajime wants to say no he just
couldn't deny the cute face that Kaori
was putting on as we saw a coyote was
pleading with Hajime to not go down to
the dungeon because of the foreboding
dreams that she'd been having but what
we didn't see was when she brought up
the story of how she first met Hajime
well more like noticed rather than
formally met it was back in junior high
and a young kid was getting bullied by
some thug Kari was there watching the
situation unbolt but was too scared to
intervene she hoped that one of the
adults passing by would step in to help
but everyone just kept walking Hajime
was there as well and although he was
scared to the bone he just couldn't
stand by and do nothing when he saw that
the thug was about to start beating on
the kid a hush Mae threw himself at the
thugs feet and wouldn't let go this
actually worked and it helped to defuse
the situation but Hajime he merely
thought of it as some pathetic display
of weakness I mean all he really did was
just kneel in the middle of the street
kaori though she was amazed she saw us
some incredible feat of strength you see
standing up to someone is easy when
you're stronger than them but when
you're weak it takes a whole lot more
strength to put yourself in that same
position so when Kaori saw Hajime stand
up to someone who was quite visibly much
stronger than him she was astonished by
his act of courage and from that day
forward
she considered him to be the strongest
person that she knew which is why she
was so happy to find out that they were
going to the same middle school together
she'd tried day after day to become
friends with him but whenever she'd
attempt us start a conversation he'd
always dismiss it or just be sleeping
Hodgman never knew that Kaori saw him
this way everything was finally starting
to make sense and he knew now why Cory
always showed so much interest and it's
why she was worried about him now
if Hajime does something reckless to
protect someone else like how he did for
that kid
then things might not end the same way
as it did with that thug Akari couldn't
bear the thought of something bad
happening to Hajime but deep down she
knew that it was a futile ask she could
tell that Hajime was working hard to
assist his classmates in any way that he
could there was no way he was going to
let everyone go without him but Hajime
knew that he was weak as well which is
why they came up with the compromise of
having Kaori protect him when the next
morning came Hajime expected the
labyrinth entrance to just be a simple
opening into a cave but instead it was
like the entrance to a museum giant
pillars and an arch created a massive
opening into the downward leading
dungeon and all along the outskirts were
shops adventurers and a few shady people
other conversing with each other or
trying to sell their goods at the
entrance there seemed to be a
receptionist type lady she was there to
check the status plate of every person
walking into the dungeon you see the
government put in place a plate check
policy in order to avoid losing too many
men it was a process run by the local
guild since the government was too busy
with preparing for war now everything
seemed so lively on the outside but once
they were in the dungeon itself the
atmosphere was completely different much
less people were around them and the
walls were all dimly lit by a special
mineral called green glowstone in fact
the entire labyrinth was an excavated
bane of that very or as such it made it
possible to see their surroundings
without a torch or magic item it didn't
take very long after venturing deeper
into the first floor to come across
their first set of monsters quick but
weak creatures known as rat men stood
before them everyone rushed into
formation
coquí's group of combat specialists
helped a frontline while Chi auras group
of mages cast some spells from range
because Koki was a knight he was given a
sword artifact known as the holy sword
it was bust with the element of light
and had magical properties that not only
boosted his physical strength but also
weakened any enemy that was struck by
the light Ryutaro was a monk meaning he
fought with his fists his equipment were
also artifacts with magical properties
a pair of unbreakable gauntlets and
Greaves that were capable of unleashing
enchanted shockwaves but finally she so
cool was a swordsman and so she wielded
a blade that seemed like a cross between
a katana and a shamshir her sheer skill
with the sword gained her a lot of
recognition with the tortoise Knights it
was these three offensive specialists
combined with the support of the mages
that allowed them to reach the 20th
floor without any issues in fact the
only threat that anyone faced was the
traps scattered throughout the dungeon
to counter this the soldiers had a tool
to detect them known as a fair scope it
read the flow of mana that these
magically based traps would emit though
it could only detect around 80% of them
due to its limited range that's why
before entering any room the Knights
first had to clear it by scanning for
any traps they eventually reached the
final parts of the 20th floor and the
tunnel walls became narrow was all taken
everyone having to go single file and
break formation in the distance meld
noticed a monster camouflaging along the
wall it was the beefier Rat Man that we
see in the anime a formerly known as a
rock mount contrary to what we saw it
wasn't Hajime that it was attacking but
rather their girls in the back which is
why Koki used such a powerful attack
like celestial flash to cut it clean in
half the attack was so strong that the
four struck the wall behind it to reveal
the gem known as a glance crystal these
didn't have any special properties or
anything but they were rather popular
amongst the nobles as jewelry in fact it
was one of the top three jewels used in
proposal rings one kaori heard this she
couldn't help but comment on how lovely
that sounded all while quickly stealing
a glance in hajime's direction it was so
quick that no one should have noticed
and no one did except for those who were
already looking at her that would be
Shizuku and yama yep he almost saw this
and couldn't help but feel a little bit
jealous so he just outright said that
he'll go get her the jewel then as you
know the gem was a trap that teleported
everyone straight to the 65th floor
dropping them on a bridge where on one
end was the behemoth and at the other a
hoard of skeletons owned as trompe
soldier
the Knights recognized the skeletons as
creatures common to the 30th floor so
that made them the easier of the two
enemies to face I mean the behemoth was
a creature that not even the legendary
adventurer who made it this far could
beat pudding meld in a position where he
had no choice but to cast the
impenetrable barrier spell known as
hallowed ground though this would only
buy them about a minutes worth of time
since the spell didn't last very long
the beasts charged the barrier and the
barrier did its job but the impact shook
the bridge and many of the students
began to panic one of the girls fell
forward right in front of a chomp
soldier it was about to strike her with
its sword when the ground that it was
standing on began to crumble a massive
pit opened up and many trompe soldiers
fell into the abyss below
turns out Hajime had used his
transmutation to protect this girl it
was an effective method of eliminating
many Traum soldiers at once so he
continued to do so while keeping an eye
on his surroundings everything was a
mess all the students were either
swinging their swords are firing spells
at random if this went on much longer
then someone was definitely going to end
up dying what they needed now was a
leader someone who could provide hope
and clear the fear that all these
students were currently facing of course
it couldn't be himself so he ran to the
best person that he could think of
koke you see all this time Koki was
arguing with Melda trying to get
permission to take on the behemoth but
mount refused over and over which only
made Cokie frustrated it didn't help
that Ryutaro was there boosting his ego
as well so when Hodgman came by he
grabbed Koki by the collar and started
yelling some sense back into him seeing
the quietest student parading him made
Cokie realized the situation that he and
his classmates are currently facing he
decided to accept the role that Hajime
gave him but before he could get to the
other side of the bridge the barriers
time limit was up and the Beast charged
headfirst into them Hajime transmitted a
wall to lessen the force of the impact
but it still sent those who were on the
front line flying backward immobilizing
melt and many of the other Knights Cokie
saw this as his opportunity to step up
so he got Shizuka and her new trudeau to
support him while he cast his strongest
spell divine wrath it was similar to
celestial flash just much larger the
light from his sword enveloped the
entire monster but
once everything's settled not a single
scratch could be seen on it the only
thing different about the behemoth was
that it now seemed angry its body began
to seep out dark red mana and it gave
off such a murderous clear that even
Koki thought he was going to die
everyone began to retreat as the Beast
readied itself for another charge it
made its biggest impact yet and the
shock wave paralyzed many of the
students including Koki only Hajime
Mallory and a few other knights were
able to move easily everyone else was on
the floor trying to recover now
considering the dire situation
Melda grit his teeth as he had no choice
but to give Kaori and Hajime the order
to prioritize coquí's escape over
everyone else's you see melt was willing
to give up everyone else including
himself if it meant that Koki would live
that's just how valuable he was aha she
may just couldn't accept an order like
that so he proposed another idea that
would focus the danger around himself it
was the very thing that Caillou Ori
wanted to avoid but seeing as this could
be the only way to save everyone meld
accepted it how she may ran straight
towards the behemoth what Kaori saw this
she tried her best to call Hajime back
slowly becoming more and more distraught
as melt just told her to focus on
healing cope reason being that Koki was
the key to everyone else's survival
aside from melt himself he was the next
strongest among them so his strength
would be needed to safely guide everyone
out of the dungeon mouth had to reassure
Kaori that this was all part of the plan
she really had no choice but to believe
him and finally cast heavens blessing on
Koki this was a high-level healing spell
that not only healed wounds but also
restored mana with this it didn't take
long for Koki to be back at fighting
strength and once fully recovered he
immediately cleared the two-hundred
trompe soldiers that were standing in
front of him all with a single celestial
flash the path was only cleared for a
moment as many more trompe began to
immediately spawn many of the students
were still panicking believing that
their situation was hopeless I mean it
really was nothing short of a miracle
that none of them had died yet but this
time melt took the lead and he cleared
the new wave of trauma with a move that
was even more powerful than Coakley's
this seemed to give a little bit of hope
to the students as they looked as if
they were gaining a bit of confidence
but in actuality it was due to a mental
focus spell that Kaori had cast
the students began to remember their
training and started to follow mounts
orders as he gave them eventually
securing their path of escape barely
moments before hajime's transmutation
could no longer hold the behemoth this
brings us back to the anime where we see
Hajime running from the behemoth only to
get hit by a stray fireball spell
ultimately leading to his descent into
the abyss everything after that is shown
from hajime's perspective what we didn't
see though was the story of how the
surviving students escaped from the
labyrinth cuz remember not only are they
highly underleveled for the area that
they're in but they're also 18 floors
deep in uncharted territory so how
exactly did they make it out alive
well let's start from right after Koki
fell to his supposed death
kyuri wasn't such a state of disarray
that she had to be knocked unconscious
by Mount otherwise she would have just
followed Hajime right into the abyss she
refused to believe that Hajime was gone
it just wasn't something that her mind
could comprehend but their current focus
needed to be on surviving and that's
really all that mattered now so it was
the best course of action to prevent the
loss of anyone else the students peered
up at the stairs and it looked as if it
went on forever just leading upward to
an endless tunnel of darkness they must
have been climbing for hours before
finally coming across a magic circle
imprinted on a wall it showed no signs
of being a trap so melt activated it to
see what would happen
a secret corridor opened up which led
straight to a room on the 20th floor
everyone let out a breath of relief even
Koki was leaning over himself since he
could finally relax but they still
weren't safe yet it was too soon to stop
and rest since they still had 20 more
floors to ascend they avoided as many
fights as possible and the fights that
they did have to take on the Knights
took care of eventually they did reach
the main gates many students collapsed
out of exhaustion or just sheer relief
and they didn't want to do anything
other than go to their rooms and call
today so while everyone returned to the
inn one person stayed behind to visit
the town he went and found a spot where
he was sure that no one could hear or
see him then he squatted down and buried
his face in his legs in a way that if
you saw him from behind you'd be sure
that this person was depressed
in reality this student was ecstatic
over what he had just accomplished
and he was giddy over the fact that he
had just taken out his supposed love
rival chalking up his actions to some
form of deserved divine punishment as he
snickered away in the corner one
classmate approached him and immediately
called him out for being the murderer
stating how they never would have
thought that the first murderer they'd
meet in another world would be their own
classmate but this person wasn't
scolding him instead they were in a
roundabout kind of way blackmailing Yama
to become their slave not that they
needed anything right now but there was
something that this person wanted and
they needed help to get it so when the
time comes
Yama has to help this person otherwise
parry would be the first to find out who
killed Hodgman as for who this mystery
classmate was well that will remain just
that a mystery so that brings us to
about halfway through episode 1 but
